column1: # Fitting Configuration File. Below this line are the options. This one contains the full parameter list. Save this sheet as CSV. Change values in the shaded boxes.

column4: Fit method to use. See lmfit instructions for possible methods. Suggest 'lmfit', 'brute', 'nelder'
This is the name for the fit (appended to plots and output file)
Name of the output directory (will be created if it does not exist)
Comments (appended to output file
allows amplitude to vary based on data. 'ratio': varies as the max height in the function,  "guess" - uses the intensity at the center positions, 'fixed' just use a fixed value
Output resolution
Output Type
If n_cores >1, code will attempt multi-core
Spectral indices to try to fit
How to try to remove luminescence. Currently only "Linear". For any other input option, luminescence will not be removed
For a linear fit, the lower indices to use for the fit
SPC Mode: 'single' - each file contains one spectrum, 'list' - data file contains many spectra, with the first row/column containing wavenumber
How to read the file: txt_column: spectrum is in a column, txt_row, spectrum is in a row, rdat spectrum is in a rdat/rmta
Directory to search for files. If nothing is here, use current directory
##Base file to read. Include wildcard (*) for batch search.

# For text loading, delimiter
#For text loading, how many initial rows to skip
#for text loading, what columns to use
#Specific keywords to pass into lmfit.fit_model
#Specific keywords to pass into lmfit.fit_model
#Specific keywords to pass into lmfit.fit_model
